description.plain:
Joshua Jagan Hamilton (b. October 6, 1998), better known by his stage name Lil Darkie, is a rapper, producer, artist, and animator. He was the leader of the now disbanded Spider Gang collective.

Lil Darkie started making music approximately around 2016, under the alias Brahman, a reference to the Brahma, the Indian god of creation.

Joshua is known for the loud, experimental music he makes. He is mostly unknown in the mainstream, but he recently gained a lot more attention and fame off of TikTok when his songs, “GENOCIDE” and “HAHA” went viral on the video-sharing platform,

body.plain:
Joshua Jagan Hamilton (b. October 6, 1998), better known by his stage name Lil Darkie, is a rapper, producer, artist, and animator. He was the leader of the now disbanded Spider Gang collective.

Lil Darkie started making music approximately around 2016, under the alias Brahman, a reference to the Brahma, the Indian god of creation.

Joshua is known for the loud, experimental music he makes. He is mostly unknown in the mainstream, but he recently gained a lot more attention and fame off of TikTok when his songs, “GENOCIDE” and “HAHA” went viral on the video-sharing platform,

songs.title: GENOCIDE

description.plain:
On “GENOCIDE,” Darkie deals with the animosity he  has received recently, mainly based around his track “HOLOCAUST,” alongside his recent ban from Instagram, it’s likely the ban was received because of “HOLOCAUST”–in the SoundCloud description of the track, Darkie said:

IMMA SAY THIS CUZ IG KEEP FLAGGING ME
NO I NOT A NAZI. I’M A LOVE NAZI.
AS IN I FORCEFULLY SPREAD MY REGIME OF LOVE

This song contains five separate beats. The first one is produced by Lil Cubensis, second one by Solsa, and beats 3-5 produced by Wendigo, with the fourth part getting its own music video.

songs.embed_content: Read “GENOCIDE” by Lil Darkie on Genius

songs.lyrics:
135 ContributorsGENOCIDE Lyrics[Part I]
[Intro]

Mind control, all my thoughts are mine to hold

I got no time for you puppets, take yo' opinion and shove it

songs.full_title: METHHEAD FREESTYLE by Lil Darkie (Ft. Afourteen, BLCKK, BRUHMANEGOD, CUBENSiS, ERIC NORTH, JOHNNASCUS, Royalty the Kidd, ​stone deluxe & Wendigo)
songs.title: METHHEAD FREESTYLE
songs.title_with_featured: METHHEAD FREESTYLE (Ft. Afourteen, BLCKK, BRUHMANEGOD, CUBENSiS, ERIC NORTH, JOHNNASCUS, Royalty the Kidd, ​stone deluxe & Wendigo)

description.plain: METHHEAD FREESTYLE is a song by Lil Darkie. A total of 10 people have worked on this song and it was produced by Wendigo. Majority of the people who are featured in this song are members of the experimental rap collective Spider Gang.  This would be the final song played throughout all of the 2021 Spider Gang East & West Coast tours respectively, despite some vocalists being absent.

songs.title: HOLOCAUST

description.plain:
This song is cold as fuck, but it’s also on fire. It is a long list of gold bars straight from the demon that tapped into Darkie’s soul when he entered the studio. It is also one of Darkie’s most popular songs, which is semi-unfortunate, because it neglects to exemplify some of the best qualities that can be found in the rest of his discography. Nevertheless, this song is insane. There is no melody at all throughout the entire beat, leaving only Darkie’s raw thoughts to be consumed alongside the disgusting bass hits. Darkie is leaving no one out of this roast session, he’s killing everything.

This song was at one point temporarily removed from Spotify, due to the controversial album artwork. It was later restored, but with the artwork omitted. This instance of censorship also coincidentally relates to the intro of Darkie’s other song, “GENOCIDE”:

Bitch, I’m smokin' gas in my chambers like it’s the *********
We’re sorry, your lyric could not be completed because—
Ayy, you Lil Darkie, nigga?
And we want to suppress your opinion fascistically

This case of censorship was not, however, the reason that “GENOCIDE” was written, as “HOLOCAUST” was removed from Spotify in early 2020, while “GENOCIDE” was released in May, 2019.

This same sort of censorship occurred again when Darkie released the single “IMPERFECT”, which was taken down because it originally featured his face with a Swastika–a script Hindus treat as a symbol of good fortune and prosperity–in the background. But this time, Darkie decided to resubmit the artwork using the “Om” symbol instead, and the message “CENSORED FOR SPEAKING OF LOVE.” covering his mouth in the picture:
